Here are some names reported by al-Khassaf [28]. He says that the mother of the believers, Aisha, bought a house and dedicated it. She wrote, “I bought a house, and it is dedicated to the use for which I bought it. It will be a place of residence for such and such and his offspring and a residence for such and such (not for his offspring), “and then he will be returned to the descendants of Abu Bakr (his father)” [29]. The mother of the believers, Umm Salmah, also created a waqf with the condition that it be neither sold, nor given, nor inherited. The mother of the believers, Safiyyah bint Ḥuyayy has forever blessed a house of Bani’Abdan [30]. In the same way, the mothers of the believers, Umm abībah and Ḥafṣah have also established awqaf (may the Almighty Allah be pleased with all) [31].
